rules: Rule1: Provided that the solar system of device1 is working, if device1 is powered on, then device1 records data.

Rule2: Whenever a marten is monitored, under the condition that it is not the case that either the battery of device1 is charged or the solar system of device1 is working implies manual power is needed for device1, then the power backup for device1 is active.
Rule3: If research is active in spring, then the research data for a marten observation is stored.
Rule4: If research is active in spring, then the findings for a marten are compiled.

Rule5: If funding is available for the project, then under the condition that research is active in spring, if it is not the case that the project is not research successful implies a marten has been detected, then the marten observation data is saved.
Rule6: If a field team is present in area1, then the project is research successful.
Rule7: Either a field team is present in area1 or remote monitoring is active in area1.
Rule8: Provided that remote monitoring is active in area1, data from device1 is transmitted.
Rule9: If the automated system is working, then the system is optimized.

Rule10: The automated system is working, or a manual check is needed for device1, or if a technician is available in area1, then if data from device1 is transmitted, the project is research successful.
Rule11: If camera1 is repairable, then it is not the case that camera1 replacement is needed.
Rule12: Either camera1 is repairable or camera1 is maintainable.
Rule13: If camera1 is maintainable, then camera1 replacement is not needed.
Rule14: If camera1 is functioning, then camera1 is not malfunctioning.
Rule15: Either camera1 is functioning or camera1 is operational.

Rule16: If the solar data of device1 is analyzed, then whenever the power logs of device1 are reviewed, if the power status of device1 is checked, then provided that it is not the case that either the battery of device1 is charged or the solar system of device1 is working, manual power is needed for device1.
Rule17: Either the solar data of device1 is analyzed or the battery of device1 is inspected.
Rule18: If the battery of device1 is inspected, then the charging system of device1 is tested.
Rule19: If the charging system of device1 is tested, then the power consumption of device1 is evaluated.
Rule20: If the power consumption of device1 is evaluated, then the energy efficiency of device1 is assessed.

Rule21: If the power settings of device1 are optimized, then provided that the energy efficiency of device1 is assessed, if the power logs of device1 are reviewed, then under the condition that the power status of device1 is checked, if it is not the case that either the battery of device1 is charged or the solar system of device1 is working, manual power is needed for device1.
Rule22: Either the power settings of device1 are optimized or the power management of device1 is adjusted.

Rule23: If the power management of device1 is adjusted, then whenever the energy efficiency of device1 is assessed, if the power logs of device1 are reviewed, then provided that the power status of device1 is checked, if it is not the case that either the battery of device1 is charged or the solar system of device1 is working, manual power is needed for device1.
Rule24: If the power connection of device1 is verified, then under the condition that device1 is powered on, device1 records data.
Rule25: Either the power connection of device1 is verified or the power cable of device1 is checked.
Rule26: If the power cable of device1 is checked, then the power port of device1 is inspected.
Rule27: Either the voltage output of device1 is tested or the current flow of device1 is measured.
Rule28: If the current flow of device1 is measured, then provided that the power port of device1 is inspected, if device1 is powered on, then device1 records data.
Rule29: If the power sensors of device1 are calibrated, then the power metrics of device1 are validated.
Rule30: Either the power sensors of device1 are calibrated or the power readings of device1 are verified.

Rule31: If the power readings of device1 are verified, then under the condition that the voltage output of device1 is tested, if the power port of device1 is inspected, then provided that device1 is powered on, device1 records data.

Rule32: If the power metrics of device1 are validated, then whenever the voltage output of device1 is tested, if the power port of device1 is inspected, then if device1 is powered on, device1 records data.

Rule33: If the animal data for a marten is processed, then provided that it is not the case that the project is not research successful implies a marten has been detected, the marten observation data is saved.
Rule34: If the movement patterns of a marten are analyzed, then the activity type of a marten is identified.
Rule35: Either the movement patterns of a marten are analyzed or the behavior data of a marten is reviewed.
Rule36: If the behavior data of a marten is reviewed, then the animal data for a marten is processed.
Rule37: If the behavior of a marten is classified, then the animal data for a marten is processed.
Rule38: If the activity data of a marten is compared, then provided that the activity type of a marten is identified, the behavior of a marten is classified.
Rule39: If the observations of a marten are cross-referenced, then whenever the activity type of a marten is identified, the behavior of a marten is classified.
Rule40: If the animal identification of a marten is validated, then either the activity data of a marten is compared or the observations of a marten are cross-referenced.
Rule41: Either the animal data for a marten is backed up or the observations for a marten are archived.

Rule42: If the observations for a marten are archived, then whenever the research data for a marten observation is stored, if it is not the case that the project is not research successful implies a marten has been detected, then the marten observation data is saved.

Rule43: If the research database for a marten is updated, then under the condition that it is not the case that the project is not research successful implies a marten has been detected, the marten observation data is saved.
Rule44: If a report for a marten is prepared, then provided that the findings for a marten are compiled, the research database for a marten is updated.
Rule45: Either a report for a marten is prepared or the data for a marten is formatted.
Rule46: If the data for a marten is formatted, then a summary for a marten is generated.
Rule47: If a summary for a marten is generated, then whenever the findings for a marten are compiled, the research database for a marten is updated.
Rule48: Either the transmission for device1 is interrupted or if data from device1 is transmitted, then the project is research successful.
Rule49: If the connection for device1 is restored, then it is not the case that the transmission for device1 is interrupted.
Rule50: Either the connection for device1 is restored or the signal for device1 is stable.
Rule51: If the signal for device1 is stable, then the transmission for device1 is not interrupted.
Rule52: If device1 is recording data, then the project is research successful.
Rule53: If the battery of device1 is charged, then under the condition that device1 is powered on, device1 records data.
Rule54: If it is not the case that if device1 is deployed in area1 then the project is research successful, then camera1 is malfunctioning.
Rule55: If it is not the case that if the system of camera1 is checked then if camera1 is operational then camera1 is not malfunctioning, then camera1 replacement is needed.
Rule56: If it is not the case that if the system of camera1 is checked then if camera1 is operational then camera1 is not malfunctioning, then camera1 has a minor issue.

Rule57: If it is not the case that if the animal data for a marten is backed up then if the research data for a marten observation is stored then if it is not the case that the project is not research successful implies a marten has been detected then the marten observation data is saved, then there is a risk of data loss for the marten observation.

Rule58: If it is not the case that if it is not the case that either the battery of device1 is charged or the solar system of device1 is working then manual power is needed for device1, then it is not the case that the power backup for device1 is active.
facts: Fact1: Device1 is deployed in area1.
Fact2: A marten is being monitored.
Fact3: Research is active in spring.
Fact4: Funding is available for the project.
Fact5: A technician is available in area1.
Fact6: The power status of device1 is checked.
Fact7: The power logs of device1 are reviewed.
Fact8: The system of camera1 is checked.
Fact9: The animal identification of a marten is validated.
Fact11: It is not the case that manual power is needed for device1.
Fact12: It is not the case that a marten has been detected.
Fact13: It is not the case that the marten observation data is saved.
Fact14: It is not the case that a manual check is needed for device1.
Fact15: It is not the case that the system is optimized.
Fact16: It is not the case that there is a risk of data loss for the marten observation.
Fact17: It is not the case that camera1 has a minor issue.
